item.title: ML for Embedded Software Engineers: a pragmatic approach [pt.2]
item.description: Part Two TinyML ML mindset The end? Part Two Part one of this introduction to Machine Learning for embedded software engineers has been the hard one. When I say hard, I mean hard as in hard skills. I tried to guide you through the learning process with development boards and code, and I ended the article with the promise the following part would be softer. How can this part be softer?

item.title: ML for Embedded Software Engineers: a pragmatic approach [pt.1]
item.description: Introduction Where to start? First steps into practice What’s next? Introduction Last October, I met Jacob Beningo and he asked me if I was curious about Machine Learning applications for embedded systems. I had some general ideas of Machine Learning: something from my Master’s, something from my job in Zerynth and Skypersonic, something from everyone-on-the-internet-talking-about-machine-learning. But I never had the opportunity to really get into it, so why not?
